In spite of the fact that I arrived to drop off my vehicle within a few minutes of them opening, I still had to park down the street and walk, as the small number of parking spaces in front of the shop were already full. They called about 2:45 to say my car was done and ready for pickup, which was earlier than I expected, so they appear to be handling their brisk volume of business pretty well.  I'll definitely call these guys again when my car needs work.

food: good for the area.
price: eh
service: good
I'm not a big fan of Indian food so I can't say much.

This is a cool place to eat have a drink and watch some sports. The food is pretty good and the service is good. Some of the waitresses are really nice and friendly. The fish and chips is awesome and you get a lot for the money. Most of the food is big servings so if you don't eat a lot you can share it with friends or have food to take home. The atmosphere is great and it is loud but that's fine with me.

Their yakitori don is amazing! They BBQ it over charcoal.
Portions and quality is excellent.  A must try if you are in he hood.
We love this sushi place! They have the best cucumber salad in town and great happy hour prices and selection. Try the Las Vegas roll-- so good!
Looks and tasted like industrial food.  It's just ok.  Nothing extraordinary about it

We've been a few times.  The whole fish is something we like to order every-time.  We like some of the item like the tuna tartar and the chiviche (misspelled) brain fart.    Overall like the menu.  Price for items versus quality is good.

I have never eaten here, but I have enjoyed their adult beverages and dance floor on several occasions.  As a bar there are several reasons this place is a win in my book:

1) They have a sizable dance floor and as a country music fan I often quite enjoy their music.
2) Since their dance floor is already big enough they often leave the high top tables in the bar area. During a night out in the Epicentre it is great to find somewhere you can dance and take a break to sit down (without shelling out ridiculous amounts of money for a VIP table). 
3) Great outdoor space with tables where you can sit and people watch the lower levels of the Epicentre.
4) They have a bull! Now that Bar Charlotte has closed I believe they are the only location in Uptown with a bull to ride. Most of the time it is free to ride. I love to mix up a night out with something different.
5) Efficiency - they've been the check in spot for several events I have attended in the city. They always make the process as quick as possible. The same for the bar staff - even though it gets overwhelmingly busy the bartenders are always able to send out drinks at a great pace.

I am not much for clubbing or going out in the city any more but when I do this is a location I like to include.

By far one of my favourite places to eat lunch! Whether I'm in Markham or in Aurora, I always seem to gravitate toward Panera. The dessert lunches are delicious but the bagels are even better. On Tuesdays, they do Baker's Dozen and you can get 13 bagels for the price of 12. While it's not a huge special promo, an extra bagel is always a good idea. They're cream cheese is also very good. 

My lunch go-to is usually the pick 2! You can choose two items on the menu for a cheaper price. The Mac & Cheese and a soup are my usuals but I'm really loving the summer corn chowder right now. In the winter, I'm about the broccoli  and cheese soup! Also the steak sandwich is another great choice! 

Whether you're eating in or taking it to go, this is a great spot to grab a delicious and healthy lunch, dinner or breakfast! It's pricier than Tim's or McD but sometimes you just gotta treat yo self!

One day while visiting some friends in Glendale we decided to have dinner at El Paso. I'm not a huge fan of BBQ, or meat in general, but not knowing the area we decided it would work. The strip mall and area are a little sketchy, but the restaurant was very nice. Our server and the food ,although not my style, was also good. 

The only negative part of my experience was the way I saw an employee get treated by a manager. We saw a manager yelling at this waitress more than once near our table for no reason. All of the employees seemed to have a general fear of this woman, and it was very awkward and noticeable. My friends and I have all worked for restaurants and we were appalled. I will not be coming back to El Paso. Mainly because I don't enjoy BBQ, but also because our eating experience was ruined by a manager. How Ironic.
